column4: This code allows me to shutdown my computer, how do I cancel it, in the terminal? sudo shutdown -h 13:00
tried searching « man shutdown » for "cancel"?  You can search man pages by typing: /cancel<enter>, then pressing 'n' and 'N' to go to next and previous hits
why do you keep repeating your question and ignoring replies?
10.04 is the latest LTS release
why do you want LTS though?
Because I am not to fond of settingup my system every 6 months
you can upgrade between releases; no need to setup again
I heard Upgrading was not as good as a new install. True?
I'd recommend you install 11.10 and then upgrade to 12.04 when it is released in april
good in what way?
As in it's different or more buggy
no, that's not true at all
Would you mind if I PM you or do you want me to stay here?
here is better
I am not a fan of unity, in fact I despise it. I use compiz to customise my desktop and Unity does not support it> your opinion?
you can install whatever window manager/desktop environment you want and select it at the login screen
I'd suggest something like xfce if you want a more traditional gnome-2ish environment
I am undecided now - 10.04 or 11.10?
why don't you try 11.10 and if it doesn't work out, you can always just install 10.04 over it.  Installs take like 15 minutes at most
The problem is I need to get my system up and running. I have 10.04 on CD and I need to download 11.10. I see your an Ubuntu fan through and through
ok install 10.04 then :)  See with 10.04 you'll need to upgrade to 12.04 before april of 2013.  With 11.10, you'll need to upgrade to 12.04 before april 2013 as well
